meanings.sent1: The sly fox tried to hoodwink the rabbit with false promises.
meanings.sent2: She always tries to hoodwink her little brother into sharing his toys.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat attempted to hoodwink the dog by pretending to be asleep.
meanings.sent4: The magician's clever tricks seemed to hoodwink even the most skeptical audience members.
meanings.sent5: The con artist's elaborate scheme was designed to hoodwink unsuspecting victims.

meanings.definition: A person who deceives or tricks others
meanings.sent1: Beware of the hoodwinkers who try to sell you things that seem too good to be true.
meanings.sent2: The group of hoodwinkers managed to convince the townspeople to invest in a fake business.
meanings.sent3: The hoodwinkers at the carnival booth were skilled at persuading people to play their rigged games.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the main character encounters a group of hoodwinkers who lead him astray.
meanings.sent5: The detective was determined to catch the notorious hoodwinkers who had been scamming elderly citizens.
